subject: Re: Google Tracking Tag feedback
preview: Hi Joel  No, what you have done is perfect. If we don't get anyone taking up the opportunity to leave a review we can always switch to automatic review request emails and update our website T&C  S

full_threads.body:
Hi Joel

No, what you have done is perfect. If we don't get anyone taking up the opportunity to leave a review we can always switch to automatic review request emails and update our website T&C

Shonagh

Instagram: @bugbitethingaus

@smartlivinghomegarden_au

Hi Shonagh,

Apologies for not explaining it clearly earlier.

Just to clarify:
  • Right now, we’ve enabled the “checkout checkbox consent” on your checkout page, which covers you for review collection under the current setup.
  • If you’d prefer to switch to the automatic review request emails (which don’t require a checkbox), we’d need to remove that checkbox and update your terms and conditions to reflect the new consent method.

Hi Joel

So if we include this box below, does that cover all we need to do? I am a little confused where it mentions we need to update our terms and conditions. Is this on our website?

Sorry for the stupid questions…



Shonagh

Shonagh Kelly 2 Bonz Place Seven Hills NSW Australia

The Kelly Group PO Box 516 Blacktown NSW 2148

Sales Manager P: 02 8811 3710 M:0413 707 945

Consumer Division E: shonagh@kellycompany.com.au



http://www.thebugbitething.com.au/

http://www.smartlivinghg.com.au/

Instagram: @bugbitethingaus

@smartlivinghomegarden_au

Hi Shonagh,

I hope you are doing well.

Confirming product reviews has been set to smartlivinghg and bugbitething. Please see the attached.

For smartliving:
  • We’ve attached both the first and second reminder emails that will go out to customers—feel free to review and let us know if you’d like to make any changes.
  • Consent checkbox has been added at checkout to collect customer permission. (Please see the attached)
  • We can enable automatic email reminders, but wanted to flag that your Terms and Conditions may need an update first. Customers must explicitly consent to receive review invitations, so depending on your customer base, you may also need to enable the Customer Consent setting (screenshot attached for reference).




For bugbitething:
  • We’ve attached both the first and second reminder emails that will go out to customers—feel free to review and let us know if you’d like to make any changes.
  • Consent checkbox has been added at checkout to collect customer permission. (Please see the attached)
  • We can enable automatic email reminders, but wanted to flag that your Terms and Conditions may need an update first. Customers must explicitly consent to receive review invitations, so depending on your customer base, you may also need to enable the Customer Consent setting (screenshot attached for reference).


  • We noticed that the site is using WP Mail SMTP. The domain is thebugbitething.com.au, but the "From" address was set to sales@kellycompany.com.au. Since this domain mismatch can lead to email delivery issues, such as messages being flagged or not sent, we have disabled SMTP for now.
Update: Joel will work on this along PoultryHQ.

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body: @joel quick note that this is the same as PoultryHQ

Hi Shonagh,

Thanks so much for confirming.

Looping in @Wolf IQ Support now to get this set up across both sites (Bug Bite Thing and our Smart Living) and then confirm.

Thank you.
Andy

Let's go ahead with both.

Shonagh Kelly

On 9 Jul 2025, at 9:03 am, Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:

﻿
Hi Shonagh,

Great to hear - and good call on setting this up across both sites.

Each plugin would be $99/year, so that's $198 annually for both Bug Bite Thing and Smart Living. The setup time is minimal (<30 mins each), and we'll cover that under your care plan.

Just confirm if you'd like us to go ahead and we'll get started.

Thanks,
Andy

From: Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au>
Sent: Monday, 7 July 2025 8:00 AM
To: Shonagh Kelly <shonagh@kellycompany.com.au>; Cindy Valderama <cindy@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Re: Google Tracking Tag feedback


Hi Shonagh,

Hope you had a good weekend.

I looked into the order volume and a more cost-effective option that could still help capture reviews post-purchase would be a WooCommerce plugin that lets you send automated emails after a purchase (e.g. "How was your order?" with a link to leave a Google review).

Annual Plugin cost and management is $149 and would take us <30 minutes to set-up which we can cover in the care plan.

Let us know if you'd like to proceed.

We're excited to help.


Thanks,

Andy

On Thu, May 29, 2025 at 11:41 AM Andy Crebar <andy@wolfiq.com.au> wrote:

Hi Shonagh,

Thanks so much for being open to leaving a review - really appreciate it!

Great idea about adding a questionnaire or review link post-purchase. We can absolutely help set that up.


There are two paths:
  1. Integrating a simple post-purchase thank you and review request on the website thank you page
  2. Setting up Smart Reviews to put them into a sequence of review requests (text and email)
What would be best for you?


Cheers,
Andy
